headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Lawmakers Grill TikTok CEO Over China And Privacy Concerns; Rep. Mikie Sherrill (D-NJ) On Drone Killing U.S. Contractor And Wounding Five Service Members In Syria; "Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico" Premieres Sunday At 10 PM ET. Aired 7:30-8a ET

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: For the American people and national security yesterday?ABBY PHILLIP, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT, ANCHOR, "INSIDE POLITICS SUNDAY":  I don't know that they got answers. I don't know that they got close to solutions. But that was a really key moment because I think it highlights the core of the problem. Moving forward, TikTok is saying they're going to fix this by housing the data here in the United States, but they can't really say that in the past or even right now that data is not vulnerable. So I think that is at the heart of the issue here and it's why that hearing got so contentious. But when I talked to -- I mean, we had some TikTok influencers on last night but we also had a lot of experts on who say that this is not just TikTok's problem.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: It's a bigger problem than that and Congress really did nothing to explore that.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: They're the poster child for it now.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But what is Congress going to do?

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, they're going to deal with TikTok but they're not going to deal with the rest of the industry where this is an issue.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes. But the bottom line is we spoke with one senator yesterday who said it -- the difference here between TikTok and others, as you know --

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes, is China. LEMON

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, but we should be clear China is a state actor. If they want access to data that belongs to TikTok or to Facebook --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Any coming that operates in China.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: -- or to any company, there are ways that they can get it. So I'm not downplaying that risk but there is risk all around here --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: -- all around.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Abby, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Abby. Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Good to see you guys.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Have a good weekend.Starting this Sunday, by the way -- we were just chatting about this -- Abby gets to sleep a little bit longer. "INSIDE POLITICS SUNDAY" moves to 11:00 a.m. eastern time. We always watched it at 8:00 a.m. and now it's going to be 11:00 a.m. eastern time, three hours later. Same network --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: We'll watch it regardless.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- same great anchor.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Whatever time it's on we're going to watch Abby.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Abby.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, brand-new video just into CNN. Take a look at your screen right there. It appears to show the aftermath of a U.S. airstrike in eastern Syria against facilities used by groups affiliated with Iran. Now, the strike comes after an Iranian-made drone attacked a coalition base in northeast Syria killing one U.S. contractor and injuring five U.S. service members and another American. In response, the U.S. carried out this precision airstrike in eastern Syria. That is according to the Pentagon.So joining us right now Democratic Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill. She's on the Armed Services Committee and is a former Navy helicopter pilot, and we're so happy to have her this morning. Good morning to you. Thank you very much. First of all, what is your reaction to these airstrikes? REP. MIKIE SHERRILL (D-NJ):  Well, I sit on, as you said, the House Armed Services Committee and we just heard testimony yesterday from CENTCOM about the Iranian threat. So to see these drone strikes was really concerning given what we've seen Iran doing with their drones across the world, not just in Syria but certainly supplying Russia in the Ukraine war. And so, I think what we saw with the response by the United States as promised from the president and the secretary of Defense -- it was measured. It was not meant to be escalatory. But certainly, you cannot attack U.S. service members and have -- and U.S. contractors and have that go unmet with equal force.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you for responding to that, Congresswoman.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes, and if we could also talk to you about your significant hearing last night on the Chinese continued treatment of the Uyghur Muslim minority population in Xinjiang province that the U.N. has now called crime -- a crime against humanity. Both the Trump and Biden administrations deem it genocide though China denies this treatment of more than a million of these ethnic minorities.It became -- it came -- obviously, you had a hearing focusing on it. It also came up yesterday, significantly, in the TikTok CEO hearing given that they are owned by Chinese company ByteDance. I want your response to this exchange -- listen. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) REP. DEBBIE LESKO (R-AZ):  Do you agree that the Chinese government has persecuted the Uyghur population?

utterances.speaker: SHOU ZI CHEW, CEO, TIKTOK
utterances.sentences: Congresswoman, you -- if you use our app and you open it you will find our users who get all sorts of content on this app.

utterances.speaker: LESKO
utterances.sentences: That's not my question. My question is do you agree that the Chinese government has persecuted the Uyghur population?

utterances.speaker: CHEW
utterances.sentences: Well, it's definitely concerning to hear about all accounts of human rights abuse.

utterances.speaker: LESKO
utterances.sentences: It's a pretty easy question. Do you agree that the Chinese government has persecuted the Uyghur population?

utterances.speaker: CHEW
utterances.sentences: Congresswoman, I'm here to describe TikTok and what we do as a platform. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Three opportunities to answer that and he didn't. What's your response?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So --

utterances.speaker: SHERRILL
utterances.sentences: -- going on against the Uyghur people in China.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Just to be clear, TikTok doesn't operate in China. They're a sort of Chinese counterpart, which is a separate company. But I know you understand that -- just for our viewers to understand.

utterances.speaker: SHERRILL
utterances.sentences: The -- right. The -- yes. The separate -- and that is the testimony we heard with this --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHERRILL
utterances.sentences: -- separate Chinese TikTok company. But the concern then tied back here is the surveillance architecture that TikTok has and the ability for the Chinese government to utilize the data that the American TikTok company has to surveil Americans here at home. And that is what's so dangerous as we're understanding more and more about how they've utilized that within China and now seeing that they have those capabilities here.And I think what we heard last -- yesterday from the CEO of TikTok was in no way reassuring.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.Well, we'll continue to follow and we appreciate you joining us this morning. Thank you, Congresswoman Sherrill.

utterances.speaker: SHERRILL
utterances.sentences: Thank you. I appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you.And in our next half hour we're going to speak to the White House's John Kirby about the drone strike in Syria and much more.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Also, Eva Longoria is here showing us Mexico like we have not seen it before. We sat down with her ahead of her new CNN Original Series premiere. What she is saying about her work outside T.V. and ha -- would she ever run for office?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Interesting.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You advised President Obama --EVA LONGORIA, ACTRESS, HOST, "EVA LONGORIA: SEARCHING FOR MEXICO": Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- on immigration issues.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes. I don't know -- I'm not that -- I'm not an adviser so much as I was --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, he asked you questions.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- I was bothering him. I was bothering him.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Actress, producer, director, and activist Eva Longoria is proud of her Mexican roots and deeply connected to the country that she calls her second home. Well now, in a new CNN Original Series "SEARCHING FOR MEXICO" Longoria is following in the footsteps of "STANLEY TUCCILONGORIA (on camera):  Ola.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Ola. (Speaking foreign language).LONGORIA (on camera):  Gracias. This is El Moro. It's an institution in Mexico City. It's -- you have to come here when you're in Mexico City. LONGORIA (voice-over):  Churros and chocolate are a dream come true for my 4-year-old son Santi. SANTIAGO ENRIQUE BASTON, EVA LONGORIA'S SON:  Yes! LONGORIA (on camera):  This one. Stop! Stop! Stop! Slow. This is the chilango in the family. LONGORIA (voice-over):  When it comes to food, we all have our guilty pleasures. For my son, it's chocolate and churros.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: For every son it is chocolate -- chocolate -- made better --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Chocolate.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- by churros.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Eva Longoria, the host of "SEARCHING FOR MEXICO." Thank you for being here and congratulations.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Thanks for having me. Thank you. It's a beautiful show.Yes, that particular clip was like Santi on a sugar high for about three hours.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I bet. I bet.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So look, you can do anything. You've shown us that. You really wanted to do this.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You call this the adventure of a lifetime.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Why did you want to take on this project because you pitched it to CNN?

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Well, yes. Well, they -- Stanley and Amy came to me and they were like we want to do a spinoff of --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Amy Entelis.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- of "SEARCHING FOR ITALY." And we want to do another country. And I was like you have to do Mexico. I was like Mexico is like a jewel of gastronomy. I mean, it really is -- HARLOW

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- so beautiful in its food culture and food is so rooted in everything in the country.And so I pitched her on Mexico. Not so much me -- I was like you should do Mexico. Somebody should do it. But Mexico is like the place you should do next. And then they said yes, and I was like oh gosh, now I have to do it. But it was so fun, and I did it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And you did it for four months --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Four months.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- straight.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You brought your 4-year-old --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- which we got to see him eat.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes. And my husband -- we live in Mexico City --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- and my husband is from Mexico City. And he went with me kind of on the six different states and even he was like where am I? Like, what is this? Like, he was introduced to a whole new Mexico.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Because you discovered a lot.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Searching is truly what you did. You --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- discovered a lot. Even though you call it your second home --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- there were so many things about it that you --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- didn't know.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: No. And, you know, I think the identity of Mexican cuisine is like tacos, tequila, tacos, tequila --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- which they do very well and I'm all for it, but there's so much more and the country is so diverse.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What I was struck by in this is also the pride that you showed on full display in each of the states you went to.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It was important for you to highlight.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: One thousand percent.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: I don't think there was a day I didn't cry from somebody's storytelling. And the way they tell stories through their food is amazing and if you're talking about food that's the easiest entry point to any culture.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You call yourself a Texican -- born in Texas with Mexican roots -- but you've also talked about what's been a significant part of your life and also really difficult at times straddling the hyphen.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes, because when I'm in here in the United States I'm -- they're like oh, you're Mexican. And then I'm in Mexico and they're like oh, you're the American. And I'm like well, I'm one of you, too -- especially being married to a Mexican national. It's really -- my household is very fun. Like, we argue about flour tortillas versus corn tortillas.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I'm flour all the way. What are you?

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Flour all the way.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: All the way.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: But that's because we're Americans. That is truly not a true Mexican. We have this fight all the time.And -- but it's really -- I love my heritage and my culture, and my roots --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- and this show really gave me a deeper appreciation for that side of my family. And I think it's going to give people a deep appreciation for the country.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So I want to talk even outside of the series about your evolution and your purpose because I think I came to know you from "DESPERATE HOUSEWIVES."

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Just incredible. I didn't miss an episode, right? And you became this famous actress. At the same time on that journey, you became and continue to be a loudvoice for rights -- for what you believe in --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- and also standing up for the voiceless many times.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Your sister Elizabeth, who was born with special needs --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- has been a big inspiration to you.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: How do you think about purpose at this stage in your life?

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, I was lucky to grow up in a family that exposed me to volunteerism very early. My earliest memories are of Special Olympics. I remember my mom made us go and be huggers at the Special Olympics. She made us volunteer at the Salvation Army, at the Boys and Girls Club. Every Thanksgiving we had to go to the soup kitchen first before we had our Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Good mom.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: She's great. I mean, an amazing mom.So she didn't teach me how to be philanthropic or an advocate, she showed me. It was just part of who we were.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Expected.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: It was absolutely expected.So before I was famous this was my work.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: This was my life's mission. And because I have a special needs sister, like our whole family was so selfless and everything revolved around her needs. What she needed. What was going to improve her quality of life. And that's a gift.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I love that you -- despite all the fame you then went back to school.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You went to get your masters in Chicano studies.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And you had a deep desire to know more about issues you were speaking out on.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You advised President Obama on immigration issues.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes. I don't know. I'm not that -- I'm not an adviser so much as I was bothering --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But he asked you questions.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- I was bothering him. I was bothering him.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, he listened. From all my research, he listened to you.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: What is happening with this thing?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: But I did go back because I am an activist and I -- and I wanted to have a deeper knowledge. I'm extremely curious about many issues and how policies affect people. And so I wanted to make the connection or connect the dots of, like -- but why -- I kept asking but why? But why is this like that? Why are these rights dismantled since the Civil Rights Movement? Why do we have to keep fighting for this or that?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: One of your main causes has been on immigration and immigration reform in this country and so many failed attempts at it. You've called it mindboggling. That's the word you used.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Oh, did I? I'm sure. I've called it worse --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: -- things because it's not -- it's a complicated issue and I get it. And there's many tenets of it. You know, we have -- we have many industries dependent upon migrant labor so we can't welcome that labor force but not treat them with humanity.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Do you ever think about running for office --

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- to actually do something about these?

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: No. No, and I think the most powerful part of democracy is the citizen. I think the misconception is you have to be a politician to be political.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So let's end where we began on the show.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Tell us where you will take us this season. LONGORIABut we go to Mexico City, which is really a microcosm of the rest of the country because everything is represented in Mexico City. We go to the Yucatan, Jalisco, Monterrey, Vera Cruz, and Oaxaca. And it was -- it was really a journey of a lifetime for me.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: A phenomenal series, I can attest to that. Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: We're glad you're here.

utterances.speaker: LONGORIA
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Eva.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You were just saying --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I've been to the Hakiev (PH).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Gorgeous.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This -- yes.OK, I have a -- I take an issue with you, Poppy.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm team corn tortilla.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, ew. Dry, not -- but Eva said that's the real deal.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It's just because we're -- I'm American that I like flour tortillas. It's much better.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: She is a force.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: She's a force I -- you know when you want people to be great because you love them on T.V. or in their public life --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- and then they disappoint you?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: She's the opposite.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Never meet your heroes, they say, because --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: -- you'll inevitably be disappointed -- but not her.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: No. I was amazed by her. And the series -- I watched a few full episodes. It's incredible. So much fun. So heartwarming. I loved her. And I do think she should run for office, just saying.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm neither a jealous nor an envious person except I love Eva.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Sorry -- next time.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I would have loved to have done that interview.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Next time.The CNN Original Series "EVA LONGORIA: SEARCHING FOR MEXICO" -- it premieres here Sunday, 10 p.m. eastern.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Welcome back.The U.S. military striking back after a deadly drone attack killed an American contractor and wounded five U.S. troops in Syria. The Pentagon says an Iranian-made drone struck a base in northeastern Syria. An official tells CNN it was a one-way drone -- we've just learned -- that intentionally crashed into its target.
